Spoilers Ahead 
                  
                


This section contains notes from Blue Prince, which means the pages also contain spoilers! Tread carefully!!!



These are my notes/a scratchpad that Iâ€™m using while playing Blue Prince.

Resources/Blue-Prince/Misc/Alphabet-Room.content:
Note: I think any letters that have multiple entries may need to be revisited. E.g., A canâ€™t be BOTH â€œRoad Rodâ€ and â€œPray Pryâ€?

















































































































LetterWordsA(Road, Rod);(Pray, Pry);(Paint,Pint)BC(Clock, Lock);(Crow,Row)D(Card, Car)E(Stage, Stag);(Pine, Pin);(Tube,Tub);(Fire, Fir);(Plane,Plan)F(Face, Ace)G(Bridge, Bride);(Grain, Rain);(Tiger, Tier)H(Chart, Cart);(Bath, Bat)I(Stairs, Stars);(Pilot, Plot);(Chief, Chef)JK(Peak, Pea)L(Flan, Fan);(Plane, Pane)M(Time, Tie)N(Crown, Crow)O(Boat, Bat)PQR(Tier, Tie)S(Sand, And);(Dessert, Desert);(Coast,Coat);(Stag, Tag);(Spine?;Pine)T(Stage, Sage);(Plant, Plan);(Tent, Ten);(Planet, Plane)U(House, Hose)VWWheat, HeatXYZ

* = Antechamber











































































---------------*EF
Moving this to Study.

Locations:


TBD
Crate, create?






^ OH, coast and cost, thatâ€™s a PRICE tag. not a dog tag.




WAITâ€¦ Commissary is now (Cart, Car), making it T instead of S? WTF??? DO THESE CHANGE?? WHY AM I WASTING MY TIME IF THESE CHANGE????????? rage
YEAH AND NOW CORRIDOR IS (SAND, AND) MAKING IT â€œSâ€ INSTEAD OF H????????
Iâ€™M SO FUCKING DONE.
SECURITY IS NOW (TENT,TEN) â‡’ T.
I THOUGHT I WAS ON TO SOMETHING WHAT FUCKING GIVESâ€¦
Okay, okayâ€¦ so I looked up JUST ENOUGH info to understand if I was wasting my time. So it doesnâ€™t seem to matter WHAT ROOM it comes from, just if youâ€™ve seen the puzzle.
From â€œHow to solve the two pictures puzzle in Blue Princeâ€ (potential spoilers, I stopped reading once I got the confirmation I needed):

Your task in each room is to look at the two pictures, and subtract the second from the first. The pictures change each day (more on this in a second), so if you get stuck, you can always try again another day.
For what itâ€™s worth, not every room has pictures. According to our testing, green rooms like the Veranda or the Patio appear to never have pictures. Some hallways donâ€™t have them. The Foundation doesnâ€™t either. This is only a problem for one day at a time, though, as youâ€™ll solve the pictures puzzle across multiple days.

Okay, so Iâ€™m gonna archive the table format I was using lower on the page, and reorganize.

Resources/Blue-Prince/Misc/Rage.title: Rage
Resources/Blue-Prince/Misc/Rage.content:
This page just has screenshots and such that were times where I was ready to rage at the game because of choices it presented me, RNG madness, etc.




I need keys, but I also REALLY want to see the music room because I think the sheet music is definitely related to it, and i have pages 5, 6, 7, 8.




AAAAAAAAAAAAAAHHHHHH ğŸ˜ 




I just ate the fish because i didnâ€™t have the aquarium but if i had just drafted this THEN ate, i would have added 30 steps instead of 20!!!


FUUUUUCK


out of keysâ€¦


86 STEPS REMAINING, 2 KEYS, 0 GEMS, 63 COINS, a TON OF ITEMS, and yet couldnâ€™t get the rooms i needed to open the antechamberâ€¦




Not rage but OMG why this is sadistic:




Iâ€™M GOING TO FUCKING SCREAM Iâ€™M LOSING MY FUCKING MIND, I COULDNâ€™T DRAFT ANYTHING TO GET ME TO THE FOUNDATION TO SAVE MY FUCKING LIFE, I EVEN HAD THE BASEMENT KEY THIS TIME OH FUCK OH FUCK




respectfully, FUCK HER LADYSHIP. this game is so infuriating. (I love it, but, fucking damn it)

Resources/Blue-Prince/Rooms/Parlor.title: Parlor
Resources/Blue-Prince/Rooms/Parlor.content:
Rules
At least one box HAS to be true.
At least one box HAS to be false.
One and only one has the prize, the other two are empty.
Iterations




















Blue BoxWhite BoxBlack BoxTHE GEMS ARE IN A BOX WITH A STATEMENT(blank)THE WHITE BOX DOES NOT HAVE A STATEMENTOUTCOME: Can we assume false? if so, that means the gems are in white.OUTCOME: IDK????OUTCOME: TRUE
Black: has to be true
White: unknown
Blue: true or false?
Is â€œemptyâ€ true or false?
The gems were in white!































BlueWhiteBlackThe gems are in a box with a statement containing the letter â€œBâ€The blue box is trueThe gems are in a box with a statement containing the letter â€œUâ€Statement: TrueStatement: True because Blue HAS to be trueStatement: False because one HAS to be false.Has B: TrueHas B: TrueHas B: TrueHas U: FalseHas U: TrueHas U: True
all three have a letter B, meaning Blue HAS to be true
white has to be true because blue is true, so black has to be false â‡’ the box with the gems CANâ€™T have a â€œUâ€
Blue has to have the gems





















BlueWhiteBlackAll three boxes contain gemsThe other two boxes contain gemsThis box contains gemsStatement: False, breaks rulesStatement: false, breaks rulesStatement: true by default





















BlueWhiteBlackThe black box is blackThe black box is trueThe black box is emptyStatement: TrueStatement: Assumed false.Statement: assumed false.
if white is true, then black is true, meaning if white is true, black is empty. but that means all 3 are true, which isnâ€™t possible.
if white is false, then black has the gems.





















BlueWhiteBlackTwo of these statements are trueThe statement on the blue box is trueThe gems are in a box with a true statement.Statement: TBDStatement: TBDStatement: TBD
if we assume white is true and blue is true, that satisfies all the trues and means black is a lie. which means black has the gems? hell yeah.





















BlueWhiteBlackOnly one box is trueOnly one box contains gemsThe gems are in the white boxStatement: FALSEStatement: TRUEStatement: TRUE
Either blue or black has to be false.
If blue is false, meaning there are two trues, that makes black true, putting the gems in white.
If blue is true, then that would make white false, which breaks the rules of the game.
Therefore, blue is false and black is true, and the gems are in the white box.





















BlueWhiteBlackAll three statements are falseTwo statements are falseThe gems are in a box with a false statement.Statement: FALSEStatement: TRUEStatement: FALSE
Blue has to be false.
If white == true, then black is false by rules of game, meaning the gems are in a box with a true statement, meaning white.
If white == false, that forces black to be true by rules of game, BUT then white would have to be true because thereâ€™d be two false statements. Thatâ€™s a contradiction. So white has to be true?
If black is false, the gems are in a box with a true statement, and the only true is white.
Gems are in white.





















BlueWhiteBlackThe gems are in a box with the world â€œblueâ€ on it(blank)The gems are in a box that is actually blue.Statement: TBDStatement: TBDStatement: TBD
If blue is true, gems could be in blue OR black.
If black is true, it means gems have to be in blue. BUT that might make Blue false, because then the gems would both be AND NOT BE in a box with â€œblueâ€ written on it? and in this scenario, they couldnâ€™t be in black either. so white? Damnâ€¦ it wasnâ€™t white. Iâ€™ll chalk this failure up to sleep deprivation.

a chance to redeem myself!

BluGemWhtGemBlkGemIfBluTruIfWhtTruIfBlkTru
If white is true, then black is also true, meaning gems are in a lie box, and blue has to be a lie, so could have gems, BUT blueâ€™s lie is that the black box is empty, meaning the gems are in black - if black is a lie, then white becomes a lie, which makes blue the truth, which puts us back at black being empty? hold on, somehow thatâ€™s a paradox.
Hang on. let my brain try again.
New chart that doesnâ€™t make my head hurt, going to use if gem instead of if true

okay yeah so itâ€™s gotta be blue right?
YES. Chat Iâ€™m so back. Someone cooked here. Letâ€™s gooooooâ€¦

yeah. it was white.

If blue is true: it implies ONLY ONE BOX IS TRUE, which means either:

gems are in blue, which allows black to be false, and white to be trueâ€¦ hang on to that thought.
gems are in whiteâ€¦ but if gens are in white, that means there are two trues, which makes blue not work.
yeah so like, blue canâ€™t be true bc white would be made true which makes blue no longer true? so does that mean there are two trues and thatâ€™s the part thatâ€™s false about blue?

If white is true: either black or blue is true, but not both. but white can pretty much be assumed true because EITHER blue or black will probably have to be true.
If black is true:  black and white turn to be true, which makes blue false, and black then says blue has the gems.

Resources/Livestreaming/Discord-Reactive.title: Discord Reactive
Resources/Livestreaming/Discord-Reactive.content:
Reactive allows you to easily visualize your Discord voice call in OBS with a single browser source. Itâ€™s like Discord Streamkit but more customizable and easier to use. Just login with Discord, upload an image, join any voice channel and adjust the settings in real time.

This tool allows you to join a Discord call and display a PNGtuber for any/all participants. Add as a browser source to OBS to include in a stream.

Resources/Livestreaming/Streamer.bot.title: Streamer.bot
Resources/Livestreaming/Streamer.bot.content:
Streamer.bot is a tool to integrate OBS, Twitch, Stream Elements, and more when livestreaming.
I primarily use it to toggle overlays in OBS when Twitch ads begin/end.

Resources/Livestreaming/VDO.Ninja.title: VDO.Ninja
Resources/Livestreaming/VDO.Ninja.content: VDO.Ninja is a free tool that allows remote sources (a phone, another personâ€™s computer, etc) to be brought in to OBS as a Browser Source.

Resources/Livestreaming/index.title: Livestreaming Resources
Resources/Livestreaming/index.content: This section details tools/resources for livestreaming (on Twitch or elsewhere, and via OBS or other tools).
